attributes.action: make no cuts to Access To Work at the DWP.
attributes.background: Access to work is the only way to  help employers to employ  disabled people.  It must not be cut.
attributes.additional_details: My name is David wilkins and I am a totally blind and partially deaf Freelance Journalist.

attributes.action: A second referendum should be carried out in the event that the EU reforms.
attributes.background: Due to fears of other countries exiting the EU, a reformation may take place within the union. If this does occur, then the UK should have another opportunity to decide whether it wishes to remain in a reformed EU or not, prior to the triggering of Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland may well be having another referendum for their independence due to the changed circumstances between the UK and the EU. Similarly, should EU reformation occur, the circumstances will  have changed. Therefore, the UK should be given the opportunity to have a new referendum on its membership in the EU.

This should be carried out prior to the triggering of Article 50 to ensure that our position and influence in the EU is maintained.

attributes.action: Make a second EU referendum not up for debate for four years.
attributes.background:
The humans of the United Kingdom won a Democratic Vote to LEAVE the European Union. 

Please ensure by a legally binding contract all referendums on the same political-economical topic have four year gaps. We cannot have a second European Union referendum this close to the first.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Respect for moralistic democracy 
2. Post-pone second referendum for 4 years
3. Over-rule petition for second European Union referendum that is desired for this year.

attributes.action: A referendum to decide whether Norwich should become an independent nation.
attributes.background: After the result of the European Referendum, particularly the result in Norwich, we believe that Norwich has the infrastructure to become an independent nation, separate from the UK. After years of neglect from Westminster, Norwich has a better chance of growth if we leave the UK.

attributes.action: Create new Special Economic Zone for London, NI & Scotland which remains in EU
attributes.background: Although a majority of the UK voted to leave the EU a large majority of those in London, NI and Scotland voted to remain. These areas will suffer the most from the UK leaving the EU. Special Economic Zones have been created in many countries, including China, with much success.
attributes.additional_details:
We know the EU isn't perfect and needs radical reform but for many in the UK that doesn't mean we should leave it. This petition requests that the creation of a Special Economic Zone is discussed in Parliament. This Zone would remain a member of the EU and contain London, and perhaps other interested contiguous regions.

This SEZ would enable these regions to continue trading from within the EU thereby fostering increased trade, investment and job creation.

attributes.action: Explore further concessions to remain within the EU
attributes.background: We propose that the government explore all possibilities of gaining further concessions from the EU in order that the UK might remain a member nation. The ramifications of leaving the EU will be devastating for the continent as a whole. All options need to be explored prior to closing the door.
attributes.additional_details:
It is evident that the UK's current relationship with the EU was rejected by a very slim margin and it is important that this rejection is respected. However due to the size of the margin and a previous offer of further concessions from it would be undemocratic not to explore all available options as long as there is sufficient support for this petition. 

We owe it to future generations to explore all options before we inflict such a profound socioeconomic change on the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in the Prime Minister & the Chancellor of the Exchequer.
attributes.background:
Many electorate find the PM's behaviour & that of the Chancellor in the EU Referendum run up well below the standards expected of holders of high office.

Speculation, "Project Fear" & blackmail threats of raising taxes if we vote leave fall below what ordinary people require of their leaders.

attributes.action: Bring the perpetrators of rape in the Democratic Republic of Congo to justice.
attributes.background:
Young girls and I mean young [under 5 in some cases] are being taken from their homes gang rapped and then left. 

I would like the UK to put pressure on the Congo offering police help if needed to stop this wave of rape and oppression of young girls.
attributes.additional_details:
You can see the story here
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/20/girls-gang-raped-suspects-free-democratic-republic-congo-president-kabila?CMP=share_btn_fb

attributes.action: Property buyers must be British citizens, not corporations or overseas investors
attributes.background: In a time that overpopulation and immigration are hot topics, we need to use the space we have to accommodate the people that make Britain great. In order for this to happen, we need to stop properties being able to be bought by anonymous foreign investors for their own economic gain.
attributes.additional_details: Over £120bn of British properties are owned by offshore companies, who don't pay the same taxes as us to the government, and often don't occupy the housing they own. The Standard revealed investors had bought at least £100 billion of property in the capital using overseas companies. The Land Registry figures also show that in just one deal signed off by Boris Johnson in 2011, at Riverlight Quay in the Nine Elms regeneration area, 15% of the homes sold so far have been bought by foreign firms.

attributes.action: To make August Bank Holiday Monday reclassified as ‘England Day.’
attributes.background: Given the rich and illustrious history of England, I propose that this day be given a new name and purpose and call it 'England Day?’ By a stroke of good fortune, historical evidence suggests that this time of year coincides with the emergence of England as single sovereign state, 1091 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Living in England is a great privilege and we should celebrate this. The transition from Bank Holiday Monday to England Day, couldn’t be simpler or more convenient, coming in late summer it would be part of the three-day holiday. This proposal is not competing with St George’s Day. This proposal seeks to promote a public holiday that already exists, by giving it status and relevance. If this idea appeals to you, please add your name to the petition.

attributes.action: Raise a vote on no confidence in the Chancellor
attributes.background:
In the run up to the EU Referendum the Chancellor has acted in an irresponsible manner.

This petition is to raise a vote on no confidence on behalf of the public whom he represents. His behaviour is irresponsible and is misleading the British public.

attributes.action: Call on UEFA to ban & send Russian Fans home after violence against England fans
attributes.background: We clearly see evidence of Russian fans attacking England supporters. We believe that violence has no place in football. We're fed up of being highlighted as trouble makers. UEFA should send Russian fans home for their poor display towards other human beings to which the ECHR holds dear.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/HooligansTVi/videos/593950987452298/

attributes.action: When a minor offence becomes 'spent', remove it from a person's enhanced DBS.
attributes.background: When I was young, I got into trouble with the police which resulted in a criminal record; these were minor offences. All my convictions are now spent but they still show up on an enhanced DBS check which makes it difficult to find alternative employment.We shouldn't be judged by juvenile mistakes.
attributes.additional_details: After a search online, it became apparent that this issue is common. There are many skilled and qualified people who are more than capable of doing there job but employers won't take the risk because of a document which states information from 5, 10, 15 even 30 years ago.

attributes.action: Debate local community bank closures
attributes.background: It is time for a debate in parliament on the issue of closing small bank branches especially in rural areas. In England the HSBC is cutting rural branches and in Scotland it is the Royal Bank and the Clydesdale Bank. This must be stopped now..
attributes.additional_details:
Customers are paying the price for banks giving poor financial advice in the past by seeing the closure of smaller branches especially in rural areas.

These proposed closures effect a wide range of people from local businesses to those who are not internet savvy. 

These changes mean that people will no longer have face to face contact with real people. Should they want this contact they will have to travel some considerable distances to a larger branch to deposit cash or pay in cheques.

attributes.action: Postpone EU Referendum so Parliament can debate PM's/Chancellor Disaster Claims
attributes.background: The Prime Minister and Chancellor (and official bodies) have argued that a Brexit vote in the EU Referendum would be a disaster for the UK. The Cabinet and Parliament should have debated and agreed the consequences before a Referendum was actioned.  The PM, Chancellor and Cabinet are negligent.

attributes.action: To promote the creation of, and eventually join a united, single nation EU
attributes.background: For centuries, wars started and fueled by Nationalism, rivalry and hatred have ravaged Europe, allowing others to surpass Europe. Now we must trancend rivalry and Nationalism, much like China, and unify to stand more powerful on the world's stage. Continued in additional details.
attributes.additional_details: With a united EU the problems initially seen with the Euro would be ironed out, with a united fiscal and monetary policy. Allowing Europe to stand up to superpowers such as China and the US. While retaining through federalism the rights British citizens would expect.

attributes.action: To introduce lessons on taxation and British law into the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that as a student who will soon be making the change to university life hopefully, I and many others are under prepared for adult life. I also believe that it is vital children know their rights as a British citizen and also the basic laws of Britain.

attributes.action: Ban plastic ring holders or mark on the product ‘Cut Rings Before Recycling'
attributes.background: Paleopathologist

attributes.action: Make the exclusion from any society/club based on gender, age or race illegal
attributes.background: In light of the recent decision by Muirfield to exclude female members for joining the club as members clearly a change is required. We no longer live in a society where the exclusion of any individual based on gender, age or race is deemed acceptable. Discrimination should be a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: It should be illegal to exclude any person from joining any society or club based on gender, age, race, or any other form of discrimination. It is unacceptable behavior to do so and whilst it may go against 'traditions' or 'long held beliefs' for certain organisations, it does not match the positive attitude towards diversity that we should be supporting in this country.

attributes.action: It is Now time to Abolish Abortions, 200,000 foetus murdered in the UK in 2015.
attributes.background: Since the Abortions were first legalised in 1967, approximately 22,000 abortions were carried out. This figure has increased over and beyond expectations. Time to Stop Abortions Now

attributes.action: Provide funding for childcare for deployed members of UK Armed Forces.
attributes.background: Members of all three Services are currently deployed throughout the world. Many of these are parents, and deployment places an extra, unacknowledged burden on the families of personnel. We are asking for provision to be made for "respite" childcare allowances for all families with a deployed parent.
attributes.additional_details:
Longer Separation Allowance (LSA) is currently paid to service personnel regardless of their family situation. As parents nowadays are expected to do an equal share it is unfair to parents with a deployed partner(or indeed ex partner with whom they share custody) to shoulder extra deprivations because of their partner's deployment. We ask therefore for a scheme to continue family life without undue burden.
See https://www.facebook.com/Help-Forces-Parents-821717114627365/ for more information.

attributes.action: Make it legal for public facilities to keep a record of lost children.
attributes.background:
Did you know that there is no national lost child policy here in the UK?
Public facilities have no legal obligation to keep a record of lost children, so they could not tell you how often it occurs in their facilities and how long it took to reunite a lost child with it’s parent or guardian.
attributes.additional_details:
In recent surveys carried out;

1 in 5 children get lost or separated from their Parent/Guardian whilst on holiday each year. (Childline-NSPCC)

1 child is reported lost or missing every 3 minutes (Missingkids)

Almost 2 out of every 3 British Adults would hesitate to help a lost child because they fear being falsely accused of something sinister (Reuters)

In the last 2 years we have discovered that there is not one standard lost child policy in place throughout the UK (FollowtheBear.co.uk)

attributes.action: Make car parking charges illegal in or around public parks
attributes.background: For as long as I remember, most public parks were for families, friends, dog walkers and couples etc to enjoy the sceneries, taking walks, picnics or generally just feeding the ducks and birds. But more and more public places are now charging people to park.
attributes.additional_details: This is unfair now on people with little mobility, elderly and families that just wanted to spend a day out without having to pay. Places like Mote Park in Maidstone for example which has now started to charge parking fees. They justify this on the local government website by stating that this is to "keep it at the high standard residents and visitors have come to expect, as well as allowing for vital improvements". I am intrigued as to when they started to "keep it" at any standards.

attributes.action: Make a ‘car mode’ setting a mandatory feature on all new smartphones.
attributes.background:
We believe that car mode will reduce the number of accidents on our roads.
Specifically, car mode would, when activated, and until such time it was turned off. Disable all phone calls, text messages and any form of application-based alerts that require the user to interact with the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
26% of all car accidents were caused by drivers using a mobile device (1 in 4). Connected Driver Survey 2015 - MORI Social Research Inst. 

Dialing a phone increases you chance of having an accident by 12 times while reading or writing a text increases your chances of having an accident tenfold.
According to a RAC Foundation survey, 60% of people "would be happy to use a 'vehicle safe mode' on external devices in cars."

attributes.action: Open a public inquiry into privately contracted benefit assessments by the DWP
attributes.background: Channel 4 Dispatches has revealed a systematic agenda to cut benefit payments by Capita, contracted for the DWP for Personal Independence Payment assessments alongside Atos. There is evidence to suggest systematic fraud and abuse of vulnerable adults by these companies. We call for a public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.channel4.com/info/press/news/the-great-benefits-row-channel-4-dispatches

attributes.action: That UK Government GOES AHEAD with distributing its leaflet on EU membership.
attributes.background: The UK government has made its position clear on EU membership of the UK.  The electorate deserve to have details of this position in order to be better informed about what will be the most important decision the UK makes this century.

attributes.action: Review childcare provisions for older children with Special educational needs.
attributes.background: This is a call for the government to review child care provision for older children, aged 11-18 with special educational needs. Due to the lack of childcare provision for secondary school aged children many parents are forced to reduce their hours or leave work all together.
attributes.additional_details: A distinction needs to be made between personal care provision and child care. Personal one to one care is extremely expensive (11-20 per hours) when compared to the cost of child care (3.50 - 6 per hour). Personal care is also on a one to one basis where older children with special education would benefit more from the extra social interaction, after schools groups can provide. This lack of provision leads to an increased likelihood in benefit dependency and social exclusion.

attributes.action: Make Burning The UK Flag a Criminal Offence
attributes.background:
There is a rising problem of protesters in this country thinking that is except able to burn and damage the UK flag in public view. 

This should be made a criminal offence as it can cause great distress and can even motivate people to take violent action against said protesters.
attributes.additional_details:
We should respect OUR flag not burn, rip and trample on it just to make a political point. 

That flag represents us all, as a leading country in this world and as one of the most multi-cultural nations. Whether they like it or not it is the flag of our country and we should not be disrespecting it. 

When they burn and damage that flag they are hurting not only our ancestors but they hurt each and every one of us with every knife that rips it and every flame that licks it.

attributes.action: Reallocate BBC licence fee to assist with the Chancellors budget plan.
attributes.background: UK households are expected to pay £147.50 per year to own a television raking in £3.7bn quite frankly ridiculous in 2016 and compares to the window tax of 1696. Money that would be better spent elsewhere, NHS, Education.... the deficit? We pay it anyway, I suggest we spend it where its needed.
attributes.additional_details:
When the Chancellor is still looking to make cuts £3.7bn would go a long way to help balance the books.

BBC finances report 2013/14 that they took in £3.7bn from households in the UK up £16m from the previous year. 

Follow the downloadable link to 'Full finance statement 2013-14' page 4 http://www.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/2014/executive/finances/summary-financial-statement.html 

BBC Finances report 14/15 - http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/pdf/2014-15/bbc-annualreport-201415.pdf

attributes.action: Lower the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the equivalent of Scotland
attributes.background:
In England and Wales, the alcohol limit for drivers is 80 milligrammes of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. On December 5th 2014 the alcohol limit for drivers in Scotland reduced from 80 to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood.
This is far safer.
attributes.additional_details:
The Scottish Government say they have changed their drink drive limit to bring Scotland in line with most other European countries, to save lives and make Scotland’s roads safer.
Many of the functions that we depend on to drive safely are affected when we drink alcohol: 
the brain takes longer to receive messages from the eye
processing information becomes more difficult
slower reaction times.
blurred and double vision, affects your ability to see things clearly while you are driving.

attributes.action: Make companies legally obliged to allow staff time off work to donate blood
attributes.background: The government should legislate to make it a legal requirement for companies to give staff reasonable time off work to donate blood and other blood products, and staff should not lose salary, annual leave, other benefits or be required to make up lost time in doing so.
attributes.additional_details: Blood donations are vital to the NHS and save many lives every day. Yet getting time off work to donate blood can be very difficult. Employers are often reluctant to allow staff time out from their jobs for this purpose, meaning staff either have to use their annual leave entitlement, go unpaid, or make up the hours out of their own time. In a country which relies on blood donations every day this is a disgrace.

attributes.action: Completely ban Sunday trading for high-street retailers.
attributes.background: Sunday is a special day, families and communities gather on the seventh day to 'rest.' Unfortunately, the majority of employment contracts make workers who would participate in religious activities or spend time with their families have to go to work.
attributes.additional_details: It's sad to see that as Sunday trading laws have become more lenient, divorce rates have increased. Family time is now more unusual and many people refused to do such things as mow the lawn on Sundays until supermarkets broke the law and got their way.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay £104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: Stop allowing the NHS to go into decline, put it back  in the public domain
attributes.background: Private companies are charging extortionate fees which are being paid for with public money.  Voters should be asked how they want their money to be to be spent or if they want to use their money to pay for high managerial positions which could pay for training for doctors and nurses.
attributes.additional_details: The speed at which the NHS is being placed into private hands is steadily increasing with more  contracts going to private providers, even when the NHS contracts  cost less for the same services. The money to pay those private companies comes from public money which should be going to the support of the NHS.  By placing the NHS completely in the public hands, Where we are given the ability to make decisions on what happens to our Health Service people would have more respect on how it is used.

attributes.action: Take action against France for enforcing the Burkini ban
attributes.background: The Burkini is a full body Swimsuit which covers everything apart from the face, feet and hands. So far authorities in 15 French towns have banned the wearing of Burkinis following completely unrelated terrorist attacks.
attributes.additional_details:
The Burkini enables women who wish to cover their bodies access to beaches and public spaces. The wearing of the outfit is completely unrelated to the attacks carried out against France. We feel that the Burkini ban infringes on women's freedom to access public spaces and to wear what they desire. The burkini ban also goes against the UDHR (Universal Declaration of Human Rights). 
We urge the British government to advise the French government to seriously reconsider the ban on Burkinis.

attributes.action: Make bad animal breeders illegal and make stricter laws against animal abuse
attributes.background: Animal abuse is a serious issue in the UK, yet it's been neglected to an extent. There should be stricter laws in place to protect animals, such as cats and dogs, and punish those who neglect and abuse them severely, for example. This includes those who breed them improperly, licenced or not.
attributes.additional_details: Also, as minor as it seems, there seems to be an inequality with how cats, dogs and other pets are treated. For example, people are obliged to care more when a dog is hit by a car than say a cat or rabbit. They should be treated the same, with everything. This includes health treatment and how they're advertised when up for adoption, among other things.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for farmers and food producers to use antibiotics routinely.
attributes.background: Antibiotic resistance is a major health problem. Much is caused by routine feeding or injecting of livestock to improve yields. This has stopped many antibiotics from working causing dangerous patient health issues and increased NHS costs. This resistance threatens ALL antibiotic effectiveness.
attributes.additional_details: While there might be occasions when farm animals need antibiotics to treat specific illnesses, the wholesale use can only increase the risk of the evolution of resistant bacterial strains with fatal human consequences.

attributes.action: liquid vapours for e cigs to be hidden behind shutters like cigarettes
attributes.background: Im a non smoking mum who knows many young children getting hooked on e cigs & vapour pens, which no doubt will continue onto cigarettes. Liquid vapour needs to be behind shutters like cigarettes. Currently being advertised like sweets in a sweetie shop. Needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently caught my 11 yr old son  a vapour pen! I discovered that most of the yr 6 in primary school were smoking. Advertising is aimed at kids lemon soufflé, trifle, bubble gum & Coca Cola flavours. Once hooked they will Start smoking cigarettes to increase the tobacco industry sales. 
Today most people are trying to quit smoking so hence tobacco sales declining. The tobacco industry are now hoping to encourage younger generation. These liquid vapours need to be behind closed doors.

attributes.action: Cancel BoE‘s cash injection to the financial sector, replace it with People's QE
attributes.background: The Bank of England’s planned cash injection to financial services will inflate asset prices, discourage saving and increase inequality. Government should instruct the Bank to implement a programme of People's Quantitative Easing instead to stimulate private spending and reduce UK household debt.
attributes.additional_details: Economists internationally have criticised the Bank’s decision, as it fails to address the greater risk to our economy: businesses and households cutting spending in the wake of increasing economic uncertainty. The BoE’s £375 billion programme of QE has damaged the UK economy since 2009 by inflating asset prices. These policies discourage saving and make it difficult for ordinary people to live, further increasing inequality and resulting suffering and anger that is corrosive to our society.

attributes.action: Impose restrictions on corner shops / off-licence shops using plastic bags.
attributes.background: We saw clear decline of using plastic bags after imposing 5p charge which benefit the environment a great deal. It is time to impose restrictions or small charge on corner shops / takeaways /  off-licence shops  etc.This will further cut out the mess on our streets and will benefit small business

attributes.action: Remove NHS surcharge on immigrants who are paying income tax and NI every month
attributes.background: Immigrants who pay income tax and NI every month have already made their contribution to NHS and they should have the right like any other working British citizens to use NHS without being double charged.
attributes.additional_details:
From 6 April 2015, immigrants from outside the European Economic Area (EEA) who are coming to the UK for longer than six months will be required to pay a ‘health surcharge’ when they make their immigration application. 
It is acceptable to make immigrants who do not work or pay income tax and NI to pay NHS surcharge to avoid extra burden on NHS funding; But it is unreasonable and discriminatory to make immigrants who pay income tax and NI to 'double contribute' in NHS.

attributes.action: Additional EU Referendum for ALL Expats.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule to trigger an additional EU Referendum for all expatriate British Citizens, regardless of the length of time they have resided outside the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
If implemented the result of the June 2016 EU Referendum means the United Kingdom would leave the World’s most influential network of nations on the base of a remarkably thin majority for such a huge step.
This is the decision of a lifetime to ALL British Citizens, wherever they live, yet the outcome was based on an undemocratic principle.
The millions of British citizens residing outside the UK are not only grass-roots ambassadors of the UK spread all over the planet but are affected by the result of the EU Referendum just as much as, if not more so, than UK residents.
However, millions of expats resident outside the UK for more than 15 years were not eligible to vote and were in effect disenfranchised. Therefore the result is not democratically legitimate.

attributes.action: Make fast food, take aways & restaurants clearly lable items containing alcohol
attributes.background:
All take away, Fast food and restaurants in the UK should have clear labels warning consumers about hidden alcohol in food.
People who don't consume alcohol for religious reasons and parents are unaware alcohol is being consumed when they eat certain products from food outlets.
attributes.additional_details: When I ate in wasabi today I asked if the sushi contained alcohol, I was told the sushi and curries contain alcohol and it's up to the consumer to ask the ingredients they shouldn't have to make people aware of the alcohol in the food. Mortified my child had just eaten the food, I was told it was my fault for not checking before hand. It's time to label food containing alcohol clearly.

attributes.action: Debate changes in child welfare law and update the guidelines
attributes.background: Legislation regarding child welfare and guidelines social work departments work under are outdated. And leaving children vulnerable and at risk.. The law needs updating and quickly, specifically sections related to child abuse verbally abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling for the law on child neglect, written in 1933, to be overhauled to protect children from being badly fed, left alone at home, not educated or belittled and bullied by their parents.

The 1933 law requires that a child is physically harmed or injured before charges can be brought, yet child neglect is the most common form of maltreatment. It is suggested that around 1.5 million children are affected.

attributes.action: Allow all alternative milks on the school milk scheme for allergy sufferers
attributes.background: Currently the milk scheme in schools allows cows milk, lactose free milk, goats milk and sheep milk which are not suitable for children who have a dairy allergy. I feel that a child shouldn't be excluded from having milk, this is preventing them from much needed nutrients and are being singled out
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see the scheme offer alternative milks which are suitable for children with allergies such as almond, oat or coconut. Another alternative would be soya, however, this isn't suitable for all children with a dairy allergy.  This would then allow all children to have the milk they should be entitled to. Milk is very important for any child and they shouldn't have the opportunity taken away from them just because they have a dairy allergy.

attributes.action: Free school transport for primary schools and high schools
attributes.background: Costs of travelling to school everyday add ups and parents struggle to pay for it. Also, the safety of the children is at risk of getting kidnapped or killed due to having to walk miles to school alone and/or on busy roads.

attributes.action: If UK weather reaches 30degrees people should get sent home from work on pay.
attributes.background:
Comfortable working environment.
To hot to work indoors. I.e factory's etc or any buildingwith broken aircon or without any Aircon.
attributes.additional_details:
UK workers.
Factory's,call centers etc or any other place with no aircon facilities.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use national flags for party political purposes.
attributes.background: National symbols, e.g. the Union Jack and St George's Cross, are often used by political parties wishing to add legitimacy to their views. This means that symbols that should represent everyone, regardless of politics, ethnicity or religion, have become linked to particular political agendas.

attributes.action: Pensioners should get the same amount of money as immigrants not 6000 pa
attributes.background: Pensioners only get 150 a week to live on barely enough for food let alone clothes heating and immigrants get thousands we should be looking after are old not helping them to suffer
attributes.additional_details: Pensioners 6000 per year immigrants 26000 sometimes more

attributes.action: I want the government to recognise  severe neuropathy as a disability
attributes.background: Neuropathy is a extremely painful progressive disease. Nothing can cure it,there is only treatment for the pain.It usually starts in the feet,then hands but eventually affects the whole body
